Sure, I can choose a melee weapon and additional equipment for Legolas. As a lawful good character, Legolas is likely to choose a weapon that is both effective and honorable. I will choose a longsword as Legolas' melee weapon, and I will also add a holy symbol and a healer's kit to Legolas' equipment list. The longsword will cost 15 gold pieces, the holy symbol will cost 5 gold pieces, and the healer's kit will cost 5 gold pieces. This will leave Legolas with 15 gold pieces remaining.

Now, let's roll for Legolas' stats. In D&D, a character's abilities are represented by six abilities: strength, dexterity, constitution, intelligence, wisdom, and charisma. Each ability is measured on a scale from 1 to 20, with 10 being the average score for a human. A character's abilities are determined by rolling four 6-sided dice and adding the three highest rolls together. This is called the "4d6 drop lowest" method.

Do you want to roll for Legolas' stats, or do you want to have them auto-generated? If you roll for Legolas' stats, you will have to roll for each ability separately. If you want to have them auto-generated, I can generate a set of stats that are balanced and appropriate for a ranger. Let me know what you prefer.
